'Kazuyoshi Miura' (ä¸æµ¦ ç¥è¯ Miura Kazuyoshi, born on February 26, 1967), [http://www.kazu-miura.com/museum/personal-
e.html Boa Sorte Kazu! - Museum - Profile - Personal Data ] often known simply as 'Kazu', is a Japanese football (soccer)
striker. He has played for the Japanese national team and was the first Japanese
recipient of the Asian Player of the Year award in 1993, [http://www.kazu-miura.com/museum/by_age-
e.html Boa Sorte Kazu! - Museum - Profile - Biodata ] an award presented annually by the Asian Football Confederation. [-
http://www.footballdatabase.com/index.php?page=award&Id=6&an=Asian_Player_of_th-
e_Year Asian Football Confederation's Asian Player of the Year winners since 1988 ] He is currently with Yokohama F.C. in the J.
League Division 2. [http://www.jsoccer.com/teams.php Jsoccer.com - Soccer in
Japan - Football News - Japanese Soccer Information ][http://www.national-football-
teams.com/v2/club.php?id=4255&year=2007&rythm=2 :: National Football Teams ::..
Club - Yokohama FC ] Kazu, whose rise to fame
in Japan coincided with the launch of the J. League in 1993, [http://www.j-
league.or.jp/eng/mission/ J.League Official Site ] was arguably Japan's first superstar in football. He played his last
national team match in 2000 and finished with the second-most career goals in
Japanese national team history with 55 goals in 89 matches. Miura is currently
the oldest footballer in Japan's professional leagues at 46. His elder brother
Yasutoshi was also a professional footballer.
